intro: Cyclosorus scaberulus, commonly known as the rough stonewort, is a freshwater algae belonging to the order Coleochaetales. It is characterized by its branched, filamentous structure and the presence of chlorophyll-containing cells. This species typically grows in shallow, nutrient-rich waters and is often found attached to rocks or submerged vegetation. Its morphology includes a central axis with lateral branches and a distinctive rough texture on its surface. Cyclosorus scaberulus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various aquatic organisms.
